slides.title: Testing expressions
slides.description: Quick tour how to check variables in a chart

slides.title: Open Settings for Testing
slides.description: Click on Testing to open the Testing Settings.

slides.title: Enable Testing Plugin
slides.description: Click the Checkbox to enable Testing

slides.title: Close Popup
slides.description: Now you have to close the options dialog by clicking somewhere outside

slides.title: Open Testing Window
slides.description: Click on &lt/&gt to the left of the terminal window.

slides.title: Set Name
slides.description: First assign a name that you will see in the chart

slides.title: Set Expression
slides.description: Next assign an expression that you would like to observe

slides.title: Select type of variable
slides.description:
Lastly, select the type of expression.
  • Number will shown as a line in the chart
  • Text will show a point on each change, with data when you move the mouse over it.

slides.title: Add to Expression List
slides.description: Finally click on this button to add the new expression.

slides.title: Remove Old Expressions
slides.description: Remove expressions that you don't need any more. Simply click on the `-` button to remove them from the list

slides.title: Start fetching expressions
slides.description: Click on the Start button to start testing. The refresh rate is set to 1 sample per second so you'll need to wait a few seconds to see anything.

slides.title: Stop fetching expressions
slides.description: Click on the Stop button to Stop updating the chart

slides.title: Clear Chart
slides.description: Click on the Reset button to clear the chart

slides.title: Switch Back to terminal
slides.description: Switch back to terminal mode. You can switch between both whenever you want.

slides.title: All done
slides.description: That's it! Be sure to check out the Extended Testing tour as well...
